thread.title: Prep football previews: W. Alamance, E. Alamance clash atop Mid-State 3-A
thread.title_full: Prep football previews: W. Alamance, E. Alamance clash atop Mid-State 3-A

author: Conor O'Neill Times-News coneill@thetimesnews.com
title: Prep football previews: W. Alamance, E. Alamance clash atop Mid-State 3-A
text: Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 12:52 AM Updated at 12:56 AM Western Alamance (5-1, 3-0) at Eastern Alamance (7-0, 4-0) This Mid-State 3-A Conference clash will go a long way in determining the league champion, as these teams are atop the standings. … Both of these teams’ most-recent games are victories against Northern Guilford. Western Alamance won 36-21, Eastern Alamance by a 41-33 result earlier this week. … The Warriors have had a nine-day break, while Eastern Alamance has had three days since it beat the Nighthawks. … Do-it-all performer Darius Pinnix has 504 rushing yards and 451 receiving yards for Western Alamance. … Eastern Alamance hadn’t allowed more than 14 points in a game before allowing 33 to Northern Guilford earlier this week. Twenty-three of those points came in the fourth quarter. … Eastern Alamance quarterback John Lamot is the area leader in passing yards (1,350) and rushing yards (953). … Eastern Alamance won last season’s meeting 43-42 when Lamot ran for a 38-yard touchdown and converted the two-point conversion with 12 seconds left. Eastern Guilford (4-2, 2-1) at Williams (2-5, 0-4) Williams is trying to snap a four-game losing streak, all of which have come in Mid-State 3-A Conference play. Eastern Guilford just had its three-game winning streak end last week. … Eastern Guilford lost 20-14 to Eden Morehead last week despite holding the Panthers to 174 yards of offense. The Wildcats’ undoing came on three interceptions, one of which was returned for a touchdown. … After this, Eastern Guilford faces Northern Guilford, Western Alamance and Eastern Alamance in consecutive weeks. Williams already went through that stretch before losing to Rockingham County last week. … Williams has been outscored 87-7 in second halves during its four-game losing streak. … Bulldogs running back Isaiah Coleman is second among area players with 752 rushing yards. … Williams’ victories are the only games in which the Bulldogs have scored at least 20 points. … Eastern Guilford won last season’s matchup 49-15. Southern Alamance (3-3) at Greensboro Grimsley (2-4) This is the All Metro Conference opener for each team. … Southern Alamance has a combined 1-9 conference record in the past two seasons. … Southern Alamance’s balance within its three-headed rushing attack is almost even. Kymani Dula has 81 carries, Tobias Watson has 80 and Mikal Slade has 76. That’s not the case in yardage, where Dula’s 744 leads the Patriots — Slade has 449 yards and Watson has 412. … Southern Alamance has won its last two games, the first time the Patriots have won back-to-back games since 2013. … The Whirlies have lost three straight games, to High Point Central, East Forsyth and Northwest Guilford. … Greensboro Grimsley won last season’s meeting 26-19 and has won four straight matchups in this series. Carrboro (0-6) at Cummings (1-5) Page 2 of 2 - This is the Mid-State 2-A Conference opener for these teams, as are the following two games. … Cummings is coming off an 18-14 victory against Greensboro Smith. … This is the second time in the last three seasons that the Cavaliers are 1-5 entering league play. In the other season, 2013, Cummings finished 3-8 and missed the Class 2-A state playoffs. … The 14 points Cummings allowed against Greensboro Smith were the fewest the Cavaliers have given up since last season’s shutout of Carrboro. … Carrboro’s only game decided by less than 30 points was a three-point loss to East Chapel Hill. … Carrboro has allowed 296 points this season, the second most in Class 2-A. The only team ahead of the Jaguars has played one more game, also. … Carrboro has given up more than 50 points in four games. … Cummings won last season’s meeting 19-0. Graham (1-5) at Reidsville (3-3) Graham tries to start the league portion of its schedule on the right note against the team that hasn’t lost a Mid-State 2-A Conference game since 2011. … Graham is allowing an average of 41.5 points per game, which is in line with the 42-20 loss to Southern Alamance in its last game. … Daniel Graves has scored 17 of Graham’s 19 touchdowns this season. … Quarterback Jamie Newman has completed 25 of 63 passes and missed two games with an ankle injury. … Graham’s only game decided by less than two touchdowns was a two-point loss to Trinity. … Reidsville has lost three straight games, to High Point Andrews, Northern Guilford and Northwest Guilford. … Reidsville won last season’s meeting 63-17 and has won the last three meetings by a combined score of 158-39. Jordan-Matthews (1-5) at Bartlett Yancey (3-2) Having secured a third victory in a season for the first time since 2002, Bartlett Yancey can continue its upswing of a season by seeking its first winning season since 1994. … The Buccaneers are coming off a 42-8 thrashing of Southern Vance in which they scored 42 consecutive points, all in the first three quarters. … Keontae Rasheed has been Bartlett Yancey’s consistent downfield threat in its run-heavy attack, catching 18 passes for 333 yards. … Bartlett Yancey quarterback Donielle Totten had gained 11 yards on 14 rushing attempts this season before last week’s 83-yard performance. … Jordan-Matthews has lost four straight games. The combined margin of defeat in those games is 28 points. … Jordan-Matthews won last season’s meeting 28-20. Eastern Randolph (3-3) at Trinity (3-3) These teams start PAC-6 Conference play coming off bye weeks. … Eastern Randolph’s last game was a 19-13 victory against Jordan-Matthews. Trinity’s last game was also close, losing 17-14 in overtime to East Davidson. … After putting up nearly 1,600 rushing yards as a sophomore last year, Eastern Randolph running back Jaron Letterlough has been limited to 427 yards on 95 carries this season. He was slowed by injuries to start the season. … This is the fourth straight season that Eastern Randolph has started 3-3. … Trinity has finished with one conference victory in each of its last five seasons. … Eastern Randolph is the defending PAC-6 Conference champion and won last season’s meeting 32-20. The Wildcats have beaten Trinity in each of the past four seasons. By Conor O'Neill
